page.title: 02EMPLOYMENT 04160531
page.content: Although the North East is regarded as an unemployment blackspot,we found that relatively few people in our block were unemployed.In the 1981 Census 9.2% of people were unemployed.In this rural area there is not a lot of industry.Although farming is carried out, few people actually work on the farms due to improved farming techniques and advanced machinery.There has always been a strong tradition of mining in the block, but since the mines closed down in the 1920s and 1930s the miners and their descendants have had to learn new skills and travel to nearby towns for work.There is no longer one main occupation but a general range of jobs eg factory workers,joiners,nurses, electricians,bricklayers,farmers and Waterboard workers.
